article.headline: Houston 94, UTEP 86
article.story: EL PASO, Texas -- Kelvin Lewis and Aubrey Coleman combined for 53 points, including 25 from the free throw line, as all five starters reached double figures in a 94-86 Houston victory over UTEP on Wednesday night. Lewis made 17-of-18 free throws and led the Cougars (11-3, 2-0 Conference USA) with 29 points. Coleman scored 24 points, grabbed 12 rebounds and had six assists. He was 8-of-10 from the free throw line. Qa'rraan Calhoun scored 15 points for Houston while Desmond Wade and Marcus Cousin scored 12 and 10 points, respectively. Stefon Jackson led the Miners (10-6, 1-1) with 27 points and Kareem Cooper added 21. Randy Culpepper came off the bench and scored 16. The Cougars outscored the Miners at the free throw line 34-23.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
